description: Ms. codex. Title from fol. 24a. Ms. was possibly previously bound with Islamic Manuscripts, Third Series no. 640, Hidāyat al-akyās ilá ʻirfān asrār Lubb al-asās, as suggested by the paper and the water stains. Additionally, according to the owner's statement on fol. 1a: "Ṣārat hādhihi al-nuskhah min Lubb al-asās wa-mā qablahu wa-mā baʻdahu fī yad ... Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá Zabārah ... fī Rabīʻ al-Awwal 1359." A similar inscription on fol. 2b of Third Series no. 640 states: "Ṣāra hādhā al-mujallad fī yad Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá Zabārah fī Rabīʻ al-Ākhir 1359." Physical description: 19-20 lines per page; written in indifferent naskh script in black on beige glazed, laid European paper. Catchwords; a few marginal notes. Headings in larger script. Some damp staining in inner margin. Origin: Copy completed on 10 Rajab 1108 AH (2 February 1697) (fol. 24a). Incipit: الحمد لله الاول بلا ابتدا والاخر بلا انتهى الذي دل على ان لا اله غيره ... وبعد فهذا كتاب لطيف حجمه عظيم ان شا الله نفعه في علم الكلام اخذته من كتب العترة
author: Muʼayyad Billāh, Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl, 1634 or 1635-1686
abstract: Treatise on Zaydi scholastic theology; followed by the first page of Risālat al-Sulṭān Sulaymān ibn Salīm ilá al-Muṭahhar ibn al-Imām Sharaf al-Dīn (Zaydi Imām, d. 1572) on fol. 24b.
extent: ii, 24, ii leaves : paper ; 207 x 152 (153 x 88) mm. bound to 215 x 166 mm.
title: Kitāb Lubb al-asās
provenance: Two owners' statements: one dated 1214 H. [1799 or 1800]; the second by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá Zabārah (d. 1961) dated Rabīʻ al-Awwal 1359 H. [April 1940] (fol. 1a).
creator: مؤيد بالله، محمد بن اسماعيل، 1634 or 1635-1686
subject: Zaydīyah—Doctrines—Early works to 1800
